input_text:
Job Title: Transportation Engineering Associate I (office/hybrid)

Location: Timonium, MD

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
The Opportunity 

 RS&H is currently seeking a Transportation Engineering Associate to join our Infrastructure Practice in our Timonium, MD office working on a hybrid schedule! 

Job Summary

We are looking for a highly motivated, recent graduate civil engineer to join our rapidly growing Baltimore area office. As part of the Transportation Planning team, you will work under the guidance of senior staff in developing transportation concepts and conducting preliminary engineering as part of studies of multimodal corridors, bicycle and pedestrian facilities, transit systems and other transportation infrastructure projects. This position offers tremendous potential for growth, professional development and mentorship, and the opportunity to work with a team of outstanding multi-disciplinary professionals.

Essential Functions

 Provides general support to the Transportation Planning Team in serving our clients on the state, regional and local levels  Performs routine assignments in support of project activities including compiling data and analysis, researching, and assisting in the preparation of technical presentations, reports, studies and supporting exhibits/graphics.  Applies standard techniques, procedures, and criteria to perform assigned tasks as part of a broader assignment.  Performs all other duties as assigned and within scope of practice. 

Minimum Qualifications

 Bachelor of Science (B.S.) degree in Civil Engineering or related field from an ABET accredited program  0-3 years of experience in Transportation Engineering and Planning  Effective verbal and written communication skills  Proficiency with Microsoft Office software  Excellent organizational skills and ability to prioritize tasks  Strong interpersonal skills that demonstrate teamwork and ability to build relationships with others  Have a passion for engineering and a willingness to grow and learn. 

Preferred Qualifications

 EIT/EI certification preferred or the ability to obtain within 6 months of hire  Prior internship or related engineering experience  Coursework that includes Transportation Engineering, Planning and Design  Have awareness of applicable federal, state and local codes, criteria, regulations, and ordinances. 

If this sounds like the role for you and you're ready to join a growing and dynamic team, please apply.

 An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. 

Please view Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP here.

 Please note: no agency representation or submissions will be recognized for this vacancy. Candidates should apply directly to this role to be considered. I t is the responsibility of all third-party recruiting and employment agencies to know and adhere to our recruiting policy .

The Company

Employee-owned, RS&H is one of the nationâ€™s leading architecture, engineering, and consulting firms whose associates work hard every day to create a more connected future where everyone can thrive. We offer an exceptional journey from start to future. Our integrated teams translate experience into insight, turn challenges into opportunities, and build relationships that are as strong as the buildings and infrastructure we deliver together. We attribute our success to an unwavering commitment to our core values of: integrity, caring, forward-thinking, creativity, inclusivity, and ownership.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
